overall_summary: The reasoning process focused on handling short-term hourly data with limited historical context. The analyst identified daily seasonality but faced constraints from only 4 days of available data. A simple averaging method was ultimately selected over more complex models (SARIMA/ETS) due to dataset length, using hourly averages from the 4 available days to project a repeating 24-hour pattern for the forecast period. The approach demonstrated practical adaptation to data limitations while acknowledging potential weekly patterns and outlier presence.
key_insights: Prioritized simplicity due to short data horizon (96hr history)
Used same-hour averages across multiple days to capture daily patterns
Acknowledged but retained potential anomalies due to lack of cleaning instructions
Recognized but could not leverage weekly patterns due to limited data
Maintained consistent hourly structure in forecasts despite changing weekday context
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with initial statistical model consideration, ultimately implementing a structured heuristic approach. Combined pattern recognition with practical implementation of averaging methodology while systematically addressing data constraints.
